trans-unit.source: Provides basic functionality for describing the structure of a data field at design time.
The IDataSourceFieldSchema interface allows a class to implement a set of properties that describe a field in a data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class implements the IDataSourceFieldSchema interface.
Classes that implement the IDataSourceFieldSchema are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of data source fields and properties for data-bound controls at design time.
Gets the type of data stored in the field.
A <xref:System.Type> object.
Gets a value indicating whether the value of the field automatically increments for each new row.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Identity property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A> property.
In SQL Server, an Identity column is a numerical column that automatically increments with each added record, thereby ensuring that the value uniquely identifies that record.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the field's <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType*> is numeric and the underlying field increments automatically as new rows are added; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the field is editable.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>, the IsReadOnly property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ReadOnly%2A> property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the field is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether values in the field are required to be unique.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the IsUnique property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if data in the field must be unique; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicting the size of data that can be stored in the field.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Length property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.MaxLength%2A> property.
The number of bytes the field can store.
Gets the name of the field.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>object, the Name property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property.
The name of the field.
Gets a value indicating whether the field can accept <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values.
For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Nullable property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AllowDBNull%2A> property.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the field can accept <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the maximum number of digits used to represent a numerical value in the field.
The maximum number of digits used to represent the values of the field if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType*> property of the field represents a numeric type.
If this property is not implemented, it should return -1.
Gets a value indicating whether the field is in the primary key.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the field is in the primary key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the number of decimal places to which numerical values in the field are resolved.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType*> property of the field represents a numeric type, returns the number of decimal places to which values are resolved, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_-1" name="-1" href=""></xref>.
